Key Arguments: The bill undermines the right to discernment and free speech.
Existing laws already cover criminal behavior online, making the bill unnecessary.
Censorship can lead to totalitarianism and is historically associated with negative outcomes.
The bill exempts government and government-approved entities, which is seen as corrupt.
Openness and transparency are needed to restore trust in government and institutions.
Main Themes: Government overreach and potential for abuse
Need for transparency and trust in institutions
Notable Quotes: Discernment is an ability that we, as adults, have the right to exercise.
A government that can censor its critics has licence for any atrocity.
Once You Start Censoring, You're On Your Way To Dystopia And Totalitarianism.
